page.title: 17TRANSPORT IN BALLYUTOAG
page.content: Most of the houses and farms in the area had at least one means of transport. Every house had at least one car and all of the farms had tractors and other types of farm machinery eg balers, muck spreaders and trailers. Some of the makes of tractors were Massey Ferguson, David Brown and Ford. One bus route just skirts the area and a private bus is available in the mornings to take children to school. Apart from this their is no public transport in the area. A minister who we interviewed stated that he lived in the area because it was close to the airport (about 6 miles away) and he found this convenient as he was often going abroad on missionary work.
